items.sentence: I want to practice French with a native speaker.
Tom was lucky that his toast fell right side up.
I can't believe people think Tom is intelligent.
I looked out the window and didn't see anything.
This is the street that I was telling you about.
We're going to leave first thing in the morning.
I'm sorry if it sounded as if I was mocking you.
Life would be nicer if it wasn't so complicated.
I would've thought Tom's French would be better.
I thought you didn't want to be with me anymore.
Tom wore an orange hat. His coat was orange too.
Tom went to the corner store to buy some butter.
Tom wears the same Halloween costume every year.
Tom was seriously injured in a traffic accident.
Tom has attempted suicide three times this year.
Tom has a German shepherd and Mary has a poodle.
Tom felt dizzy after blowing up thirty balloons.
Tom didn't even try to convince Mary to do that.
Tom asked Mary where she had bought her bicycle.
Tom asked Mary to keep doing what she was doing.
Tom asked Mary to be more careful the next time.
The doctors assured Tom that Mary would recover.
Neither Tom nor Mary has spent any time in jail.
Neither Tom nor Mary has caused us much trouble.
Neither Tom nor Mary has begun to look for work.
If by any chance Tom comes, give him this paper.
Earlier, Tom was on the balcony talking to Mary.
Tom takes care of the kids on Monday afternoons.
Tom said that he wanted to speak to the manager.
Tom put his glasses on the table beside his bed.
Tom parked in the parking lot behind the school.
Tom is the only one who really knows what to do.
Tom hid his face in the pillow and began to cry.
Tom hasn't yet told us what happened that night.
Tom has already decided where he's going to eat.
Tom hasn't yet finished his homework assignment.
Tom hasn't finished his homework assignment yet.
Mary hugged Tom and told him that she loved him.
Mary hopes that Tom will teach her how to drive.
Mary is depressed because Tom broke up with her.
Mary said she expected Tom to eat lunch with us.
Mary said she didn't want me to do that for Tom.
Mary said Tom didn't want to eat lunch with her.
Mary promised Tom she wouldn't eat his sandwich.
Mary passes by Tom's house on her way to school.
Mary is probably going to tell Tom she's sleepy.
Did you really think I was the one who did that?
There are many Americans who can speak Japanese.
Learning is one thing, and common sense another.
We have kept in constant touch for twenty years.
